results.title: 12 Angry men
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Terence A. Donnelly and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A young man is accused of fatally stabbing his father, and his fate now lies in the hands of his “peers”: 12 men from all walks of life, different backgrounds, who all bring their own agendas and prejudices with them. Is he innocent or guilty? Is there reasonable doubt? The tension mounts as each piece of evidence is examined again and again. This film provides the viewer with an insight into the American legal system and what may happen behind the scenes of any murder trial. This is an emotionally charged courtroom drama with a star studded cast including Courtney B Vance, Ossie Davis, George C Scott, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Dorian Harewood, James Gandolfini, Tony Danza, Jack Lemon, Hume Croyn, Mykelti Williamson, Edward James and Olmas William Peterson.

results.title: Oscar and Lucinda
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Timothy White, Robin Dalton and Fox Searchlight
results.brief_description: Based on Peter Carey’s Booker Prize-winning novel, Gillian Armstrong’s “Oscar and Lucinda” is a lyrical story about chance, fate and love. Set in the 19th century it tells the story of how two eccentric characters are brought together by fate and an obsession with gambling. Lucinda Leplastrier (Cate Blanchett) is an unconventional woman living in a society obsessed with normality. She uses her inheritance to buy a glassworks factory in Sydney. Returning from London by ship she meets Oscar Hopkins, a strange Anglican minister terrified by the ocean but compulsively attracted to gambling. When their paths meet again in Sydney they embark on an incredible mission to take a glass church into the heart of the Australian bush. With a cast of wonderful Australian and British actors, Cate Blanchett shines in a role which heralded her international film career. Laura Jones has done a good job of translating Carey’s dense novel to the screen, and Luciana Arrighi’s production design and Geoffrey Simpson’s cinematography create a sumptuous backdrop to the characters’ journeying.

results.title: Sliding doors
results.creator_credit: Peter Howitt, William Horberg, Philippa Braithwaite, Sydney Pollack, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Losing her job triggers a strange turn of events for Helen (Gwyneth Paltrow) when she discovers two possibilities for her future. These possibilities are based on the sliding door which signifies whether she catches or misses the train home, and these two scenarios are followed in a parallel sequence. In the world in which she misses her train, Helen works hard at menial jobs to support herself and her unfaithful, writer boyfriend Gerry (John Lynch). In the world in which she catches the train, Helen discovers that getting over discovering Gerry’s infidelity is not as bad as she thought when she begins a relationship with James (John Hannah). Through her happiness however comes unexpected confusion, as nothing is as it seems on the surface. Ultimately the two worlds coalesce, but only one man can accompany her into the future. Cast includes Jean Tripplehorn, Zara Turner and Douglas McFerran.

results.title: Phantom from 10,000 leagues
results.creator_credit: Dan Warner, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Curious title, considering the phantom rarely lurks deeper than six feet or so underwater. Kent Taylor and Rodney Bell are investigating several mysterious underwater deaths, supposedly caused by a sea “phantom.” The pair suspect that a professor of oceanography (Michael Whalen) knows something about the phantom, which he most certainly does. The phantom, a mutated sea monster, is the result of the professor’s evil experiments with an “atomic ray.” Both villain and phantom (which looks like an ulcerated beach toy) are dispatched by a few sticks of TNT. Famous for winning a ‘Golden Turkey’ award.

results.title: Head On
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.brief_description: Ana Kokkinos’s debut follows the angry, confused and nihilistic 19-year-old Greek Australian, Ari (Alex Dimitriades) through 24 hours fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Bilcock, Ana Kokkinos, Jane Scott and Head On Productions
results.description:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.

results.title: Post coitum = Animal triste
results.creator_credit: Brigitte Rouan, Humbert Balsan, Pinou Film and Ognon Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Brigitte Rouan (in a brave move), casts herself as Diane Clovier, a happily married career woman who falls passionately in love with a man twenty years younger than herself, Emilio (Boris Tegal). She begins an affair with him, and is debilitated by the ensuing desire and love that consumes them while they’re together. Emilio accompanies Diane to Prague where she threatens to ruin her professional reputation by putting her desires before work. Diane’s affair is blatantly obvious to her husband, Phillipe (Patrick Chesnais), however he tacitly lets the affair continue in the hope that it will soon end. When he is employed as the defence lawyer for Madame Dupleche who has been charged with murdering an abusive, unfaithful husband, it causes him, as well as Diane, to question the situation they find themselves in and to discover what makes them happy. Cast includes Boris Terral, Nils Tavernier and Patrick Chesnais. In French with English subtitles.

constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Cinema City Co, Film Workshop
results.description: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Enlisting the help of a mysterious Taoist monk (Wu Ma), the young tax collector tries to free the girl’s spirit and lay it to rest before her eminent marriage to the evil mountain demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Wild things
results.creator_credit: John McNaughton, Steven A Jones, Rodney Liber and Mandalay Entertainment
results.brief_description: Wild Things is a steamy thriller about two high school students, the guidance counsellor they accuse of rape, and the detective who suspects there’s more to the story. This mystery of deceit, sex, greed and power moves from Blue Bay’s elite beach communities into the murky swampy waters of the Everglades at a rapid pace with unpredictable plot twists abundant. Cast includes: Kevin Bacon, Matt Dillon, Neve Campbell, Theresa Russell, Robert Wagner and Bill Murray.

results.title: In the wake of the Bounty
results.brief_description: Chauvel’s first “talkie”, this film merges documentary footage and dramatic historical reconstruction. Re-enacts the mutiny led by Fletcher Christian (Errol Flynn) in 1789 against the master of the Bounty, William Bligh (Mayne Lynton), and depicts the fate of the mutineers on Tahiti and remote Pitcairn Island. Provides a unique and spectacular record of the life of the isolated community of Pitcairn in 1932 with most of the inhabitants being descendants of the Bounty mutineers. This was the first film shot on Pitcairn Island and the first in which the Australian actor, Errol Flynn, appeared. The dramatised footage was shot at the Cinesound Studio in Sydney. Cast also includes Victor Gouriet and John Warwick

results.title: Here's looking at you, Warner Bros.
results.creator_credit: Robert Guenette, Wolper Organisation and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This feature length documentary celebrates 90 years of moviemaking history at Warner Bros in Hollywood. An entertaining chronicle of the studio’s history unfolds using choice moments from classic Warner films, interviews with artists and technicians, early screentests by Lana Turner, Orson Welles, Marlon Brando and Paul Newman, bloopers by Ronald Reagan and James Cagney and historical behind-the-scenes footage. Narrated by Clint Eastwood, Barbra Streisand, Goldie Hawn, Steven Spielberg and Chevy Chase.
